questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring the monitoring for a new application server. During the day, the CPU on the server is baselined at approximately 30% utilization. At midnight, a batch job is scheduled to run that will drive the CPU utilization up to 75% for approximately an hour. Any time the CPU utilization is at 40% or higher for longer than ten minutes, administrators will receive an alert. Which of the following is the BEST method to ensure administrators do not experience message fatigue due to false alerts?

discussion.content: setting the server on maintenance mode should've been an option

choices.D: Manually disable monitoring during the batch job.
choices.A: Set a different threshold during the batch peak time.
choices.C: Increase the alert utilization threshold to 80%.
choices.B: Increase the alert time threshold to 65 minutes.

discussion.content: Wildcard values in certificates is not the smartest - Answer is A
The error they receive is really vague, but couldn't it be any of these?

comments.content: Agreed, it's a bad question. My thinking is that because it's a new site then it's probably a new cert too (thus likely not revoked or expired yet) and it just seems unlikely that an unsigned cert would be used for public sites, leaving A as the *most* likely

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator configures a new web server for the site https://companyname.com. The administrator installs a wildcard SSL certificate for
*.companyname.com. When users attempt to access the site, a certificate error is received. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the error?

discussion.content: Should be C,D. The purpose of Load testing and fail over testing is to ensure the service is available. Penetration testing tests security by simulating a cyber attack.

questions.question_text: A cloud service company is proposing a solution to a major sporting venue. The solution offers 99.999% availability during special events, which is proven through specialized testing. Which of the following techniques should be applied to confirm the high availability claimed by the company? (Choose two.)
